prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover:  include John Gilbert clearly and mention ‚ÄúAI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025‚Äù. make the artwork in general beautiful, charming, but also appropriately professional. Include a nice tree in front cover. don‚Äôt draw any people. use white background"
Style: ‚ú® Smart Style
Tone: üåü Inspirational - motivating and uplifting
To: John Gilbert
From: Vibecarding.com Team
Message: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the motivating and uplifting tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a warm, minimalist watercolor and ink style. The front of the card features a single, beautifully rendered tree, reminiscent of a mighty oak or a resilient redwood, symbolizing wisdom, growth, and enduring thought. The watercolor is applied with a gentle, wet-on-wet technique, allowing soft, earthy greens and rich, warm browns to bleed into each other gracefully, creating a sense of natural, organic life. Fine, delicate ink lines are used to define the branches and a few key leaves, adding a touch of sophisticated detail without sacrificing the soft, painterly feel. The overall composition is clean and serene against the crisp white background, conveying a professional yet deeply personal and heartfelt sentiment. This style feels hand-crafted and thoughtful, like a piece of personal art created to express genuine gratitude.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with motivating and uplifting tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a warm, minimalist watercolor and ink style. The front of the card features a single, beautifully rendered tree, reminiscent of a mighty oak or a resilient redwood, symbolizing wisdom, growth, and enduring thought. The watercolor is applied with a gentle, wet-on-wet technique, allowing soft, earthy greens and rich, warm browns to bleed into each other gracefully, creating a sense of natural, organic life. Fine, delicate ink lines are used to define the branches and a few key leaves, adding a touch of sophisticated detail without sacrificing the soft, painterly feel. The overall composition is clean and serene against the crisp white background, conveying a professional yet deeply personal and heartfelt sentiment. This style feels hand-crafted and thoughtful, like a piece of personal art created to express genuine gratitude.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a warm, minimalist watercolor and ink style. The front of the card features a single, beautifully rendered tree, reminiscent of a mighty oak or a resilient redwood, symbolizing wisdom, growth, and enduring thought. The watercolor is applied with a gentle, wet-on-wet technique, allowing soft, earthy greens and rich, warm browns to bleed into each other gracefully, creating a sense of natural, organic life. Fine, delicate ink lines are used to define the branches and a few key leaves, adding a touch of sophisticated detail without sacrificing the soft, painterly feel. The overall composition is clean and serene against the crisp white background, conveying a professional yet deeply personal and heartfelt sentiment. This style feels hand-crafted and thoughtful, like a piece of personal art created to express genuine gratitude.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a warm, minimalist watercolor and ink style. The front of the card features a single, beautifully rendered tree, reminiscent of a mighty oak or a resilient redwood, symbolizing wisdom, growth, and enduring thought. The watercolor is applied with a gentle, wet-on-wet technique, allowing soft, earthy greens and rich, warm browns to bleed into each other gracefully, creating a sense of natural, organic life. Fine, delicate ink lines are used to define the branches and a few key leaves, adding a touch of sophisticated detail without sacrificing the soft, painterly feel. The overall composition is clean and serene against the crisp white background, conveying a professional yet deeply personal and heartfelt sentiment. This style feels hand-crafted and thoughtful, like a piece of personal art created to express genuine gratitude.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover of a greeting card, 9:16 ratio, featuring a stylized tree with a lightbulb base. The tree's trunk and branches are rendered in thin, delicate brown ink lines, with a subtle watercolor wash suggesting warmth. Instead of leaves, the branches are adorned with various colorful geometric shapes: light blue squares, teal circles, green triangles, and golden yellow triangles and squares. The watercolor application is soft and blended, with a clean, white background that emphasizes the central illustration. The overall style is minimalist, elegant, and symbolic, conveying growth, ideas, and professionalism. Below the tree, centered in the lower half of the card, the text \"John Gilbert\" is displayed in a bold, clean, sans-serif black font. Underneath, in a slightly smaller, equally clean black font, reads \"AI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025\". The mood is inspirational and professional, with a hint of artistic charm. The artistic style is a blend of minimalist watercolor and precise ink illustration, creating a sophisticated and unique visual.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a greeting card, 9:16 ratio, continuing the minimalist watercolor and ink style of the front cover. The design subtly references the geometric motifs from the front cover, perhaps with a few scattered, soft watercolor shapes (e.g., a faint blue circle or a muted yellow triangle) in the upper left or center area. The primary focus is on creating a serene and resolved atmosphere. There are no people or text. The bottom right corner (approximately 1 inch square) is intentionally left completely clear and undecorated for a QR code. The overall composition is clean, peaceful, and artistically understated, complementing the front cover's theme of growth and ideas without being overly complex.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior page of a greeting card, 9:16 ratio, maintaining the minimalist watercolor and ink style with a white background. This page develops the visual narrative by expanding on the symbolism of growth and interconnectedness. It could feature delicate, flowing ink lines that suggest a gentle breeze or the spread of ideas, subtly interweaving with faint watercolor washes in earthy tones or muted colors from the front cover's palette. Perhaps a subtle pattern of the geometric shapes appears in a very soft, diffused manner, or a single, larger abstract watercolor shape that evokes the 'good' or 'prospering thought' mentioned in the theme. The overall mood is calm, inspirational, and visually harmonious with the front cover, creating a sense of gentle unfolding and thoughtful consideration. No text or people are present.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior page of a greeting card, 9:16 ratio, featuring the message text integrated into a beautiful, innovative decorative artwork, consistent with the minimalist watercolor and ink style. The text \"John, Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone. With sincere appreciation, The Vibecarding.com Team\" is written in an elegant, flowing cursive script, rendered in a rich ink color that complements the watercolor elements. The artistic elements surrounding the text are abstract and sophisticated, possibly abstract watercolor blooms in soft, warm hues, or delicate ink-drawn tendrils that gracefully frame the message. These elements should not depict people but rather evoke inspiration and thoughtful reflection, harmonizing with the 'AI for Good' and 'prospering thought' theme. The composition is balanced, ensuring the text is easily readable while the artwork enhances the heartfelt and professional tone."
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a warm, minimalist watercolor and ink style. The design features a single, bare branch extending from the left side, rendered with delicate brown ink lines and subtle watercolor washes. From the branch hangs a single, small, golden-yellow triangle. Below the branch, also rendered with delicate watercolor, is a small, soft blue circle. The rest of the background is a clean, textured off-white. The composition is minimal and serene, with the decorative elements confined to the upper left quadrant of the card. The bottom-right corner, approximately a 1-inch square, is intentionally left completely clear and undecorated to allow space for a QR code. The overall aesthetic is quiet, sophisticated, and subtly artistic, providing a peaceful and complementary resolution to the card's visual story.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a "Smart Style" and "Inspirational" tone, rendered in a warm, minimalist watercolor and ink style. The composition features soft, abstract watercolor shapes in muted yellow and blue-green hues, bleeding gently into each other. Delicate, thin ink lines create an abstract interconnected network over these watercolor forms. Centered within the artwork, in a beautiful, flowing, handwritten cursive script, is the quote: "The best way to predict the future is to create it". The handwriting is elegant and legible, with natural variations in line weight, suggesting a pen-like quality. The background is a clean, off-white, with subtle watercolor splatters adding texture. The overall impression is serene, intellectual, and visually harmonious, with no people present, designed to convey a thoughtful and uplifting message.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior:
Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a focus on minimalist watercolor shapes and elegant cursive typography. The background is a clean white, providing ample space for the handwritten message. The message itself, "Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone. With sincere appreciation, The Vibecarding.com Team," is presented in a flowing, legible cursive script, reminiscent of a fountain pen with subtle variations in line weight. This handwritten text is positioned centrally, with sufficient padding from the edges, allowing for printing and potential handwritten additions.

Decorative elements are minimal and abstract, maintaining a sophisticated and professional yet warm tone. In the upper left quadrant, a soft, muted sage green watercolor square is placed. In the lower right, a gentle sky blue watercolor circle and a warm ochre watercolor triangle are arranged in a balanced composition. These shapes are rendered with a delicate watercolor wash technique, featuring soft edges and subtle color variations, evoking a sense of calm and thoughtfulness. The overall artistic style is a warm, minimalist watercolor and ink, with the watercolor washes creating a painterly texture and fine ink lines subtly defining elements where necessary, though in this specific interior page, the focus is on the watercolor shapes rather than ink outlines. The design prioritizes readability and emotional resonance for the message, using abstract forms to create visual interest without overpowering the sentiment.
